concept.title: Configuring passwordless secure administration
concept.shortdesc: You can configure passwordless administration of the appliance by using a previously generated SSH key. This configuration allows remote scripts to run CLI commands without requiring interactive entry of a user ID and password.

section.title: Enabling passwordless secure administration
section.p: You might want to use passwordless administration so that you can write remote scripts to create or retrieve monitoring data. You can also write remote scripts to create number of messaging objects. For example, message hubs, endpoints, or policies for a particular environment.
The user sshkey add command can be used to configure passwordless secure administration of the appliance. You can type help user on the appliance command line to get the syntax.

section.title: Disabling passwordless secure administration
section.p: You might want to disable passwordless administration to strengthen your security. For example, an administrator with a revoked password might still be able to access the appliance by using a passwordless SSH login.
The user sshkey delete command can be used to disable passwordless administration of the appliance. You can type help user on the appliance command line to get the syntax.
